How do I use the `verus` command to send a JSON RPC request to a remote server?

The `verus` command is not used to send a JSON RPC request to a remote server. Instead, it is used to execute Verus commands locally. To send a JSON RPC request, you would use a tool like `curl`, as shown in the example: `curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblocktemplate", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/`.

Examples:
> verus getblocktemplate 
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblocktemplate", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
